info.description: We are developing a new RESTful API. Existing Open APIs are not removed for compatibility, but are no longer maintained.
info.title: JENNIFER5 API Reference

get.summary: API which responds according to the data related to the list of real-time Active Services at the time of search.

parameters.name: domain_id
parameters.description: domain_id

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description: Specify the instance id to query the information of a specific instance. To query multiple instance separate each id by a comma "," (ex, instance_id=1001.1002). If the value was Null, the application information of all instances of the domain will be retrieved.

post.summary: API which responds according to the data related to the list of real-time Active Services at the time of search.

parameters.name: domain_id
parameters.description: domain_id

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description: Specify the instance id to query the information of a specific instance. To query multiple instance separate each id by a comma "," (ex, instance_id=1001.1002). If the value was Null, the application information of all instances of the domain will be retrieved.

get.summary: From among Domain/Instance/Business, APIs with which the user can check the retrieval results by Business.

parameters.name: business_id
parameters.description: business_id

parameters.name: domain_id
parameters.description: domain_id

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Error occurs when the end time is smaller than startTime.

parameters.name: interval_minute
parameters.description: interval_minute

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.description: metrics

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Unix TimeStamp (milisecond unit) / Display of time in accordance with the definition of time_string

parameters.name: time_pattern
parameters.description: Defines the temporal input value pattern and the temporal output value pattern. If there is no time_pattern variable value, both the input and output values use the unix timestampValue.

get.summary: API to view the results of search on ERROR in DB Search (Only support list, since 5.2.3 )

parameters.name: domain_id
parameters.description: domain_id

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: If endTime is less than startTime, an error occurs.

parameters.name: error_type
parameters.description: Able to specify Type of ERRORs . (All characters of string are should be capitalized)

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description: If it is null, the application information of all the Instances of the Domain is fetched. In order to query the information of individual Instance, it can be retrieved in the form of array concatenated with ',' character. e.g. instance_id=10001,10002

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Time notation as defined by Unix TimeStamp (in milisecond)/time_pattern

parameters.name: time_pattern
parameters.description: Defines input value and output value patterns corresponding a time. It can be used as in the format of YYYYMMdd or YYYYMMddHH. If the value of the time_pattern variable does not exist, the unix timestamp value is used as the input value.

post.summary: API to view the results of search on ERROR in DB Search (Only support list, since 5.2.3 )

parameters.name: domain_id
parameters.description: domain_id

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: If endTime is less than startTime, an error occurs.

parameters.name: error_type
parameters.description: Able to specify Type of ERRORs . (All characters of string are should be capitalized)

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description: If it is null, the application information of all the Instances of the Domain is fetched. In order to query the information of individual Instance, it can be retrieved in the form of array concatenated with ',' character. e.g. instance_id=10001,10002

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Time notation as defined by Unix TimeStamp (in milisecond)/time_pattern

parameters.name: time_pattern
parameters.description: Defines input value and output value patterns corresponding a time. It can be used as in the format of YYYYMMdd or YYYYMMddHH. If the value of the time_pattern variable does not exist, the unix timestamp value is used as the input value.

get.summary: API to view the results of search on Application Servicein Application Status

parameters.name: domain_id
parameters.description: domain_id

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Error occurs if the end time is smaller than the start time (Note: Units below hour must be set to zero)

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description: Brings the application information of all Instances in the Domain when the value is Null. Able to retrieve the information of an individual instance using an arrangement form connected with the ',' character. e.g.) instance_id=10001,10002

parameters.name: max_row
parameters.description: Maximum number of results

parameters.name: sort_by_metrics
parameters.description: Reference metrics for alignment. The default value is calls (Calls)

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Display of time according to the definition of Unix TimeStamp or time_pattern (Note: Units below hour must be set to zero)

parameters.name: time_pattern
parameters.description: Defines the pattern of the input value and output value corresponding to time. Either YYYYMMdd or YYYYMMddhh format is used. If there is no time_pattern variable, the unix timestamp value is used as an input value.

parameters.description: Defines the pattern of the input value and output value corresponding to time. Either YYYYMMdd or YYYYMMddhh format is used. If there is no time_pattern variable, the unix timestamp value is used as an input value.

get.summary: Getting a JENNIFER Users

businessId.description: ID values of Business. It returns array.

runningMode.description: Shows whether SQL or External Call of active service state is performed

statusElapseTime.description: Elapsed Time means the elapsed execution time in the corresponding state, and the unit is ms.

totalCpuTime.description: Sum of total CPU times of the application

totalExternalCallTime.description: Sum of total External Call times of the application

totalFetchTime.description: Sum of total Fetch times of the application

totalResponseTime.description: Sum of total response times of the application

totalSqlTime.description: Sum of total External Call times of the application

badResponseTime.description: BAD_RESPONSE_TIME_ERROR default value. Refer to Table Column Descriptions of Business.

ruleList.description: Rule of Business are configured. Returns in an arrangement form, as it is possible to return as multiple strings.

time.description: Time as the standard of value.

value.description: Search results according to the search options.

applicationName.description: Name of Application Service raised the ERROR. If it does not exist, Null

profileIndex.description: ERROR Profile Index of Transaction. If it does not exist, Null

txid.description: ID of Transaction raised the EVENT, If it does not exist, Null

value.description: Value of the ERROR. If it does not exist, Null

applicationName.description: Name of Application Service raised the EVENT

errorType.description: If the EVENT is raised by ERROR, this is Type of ERRORs

metricsName.description: If the EVENT is raised by Metrics, this is name of Metrics. Refer to Detailed Descriptions for Each Metric

txid.description: ID of X-View Basic Data raised the EVENT

description.description: Description of Instance input by the user

version.description: Version of JENNIFER agent installed in Instance

business.description: List of Metrics in a Business unit

domain.description: List of Metrics in a Domain unit

instance.description: List of Metrics in an Instance unit

activeServiceRangeCount0.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in blue

activeServiceRangeCount1.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in yellow

activeServiceRangeCount2.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in orange

activeServiceRangeCount3.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in red

activeServiceRangeCount0.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in blue

activeServiceRangeCount1.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in yellow

activeServiceRangeCount2.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in orange

activeServiceRangeCount3.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in red

hitHour.description: Total time taken for applicable Calls

rejectRate.description: Number of application services per second rejected by PLC (refer toLoad Control (PLC, Peak Load Control)

activeServiceRangeCount0.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in blue

activeServiceRangeCount1.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in yellow

activeServiceRangeCount2.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in orange

activeServiceRangeCount3.description: Number of Active Service Equalizer services in red

hitHour.description: Total time taken for applicable Calls

rejectRate.description: Number of application services rejected by PLC (refer toLoad Control (PLC, Peak Load Control))

totalResponseTime.description: Sum of total response times of the SQL

businessId.description: ID value of Business. (A single transaction can belong to multiple businesses)

businessName.description: Name of Business. (A single transaction can belong to multiple businesses)

clientId.description: Client-specific ID, which is managed by HTTP cookies. Only collected when the monitoring target is the web application server.

clientIp.description: IP address of the client computer from which a transaction is requested. Only collected when the monitoring target is the web application server and the client IP is included in the header.

cpuTime.description: Refers to the CPU time used in the process of performing a transaction.

endTime.description: Time at which a transaction ends. End time is identified when the end of the transaction is recorded based on application server time.

errorType.description: One of the errors occurring in the process of performing a transaction. The last occurring error is displayed on the column.

externalcallTime.description: Time taken to perform an external transaction in the process of performing a transaction.

fetchTime.description: Time taken to perform an SQL FETCH in the process of performing a transaction. Fetch uses a special measurement method.

frontendTime.description: Time taken in the browser during the period from the user's request to the response. Separate settings are required.

guid.description: Global key to group several transactions into a single group. Only transactions to which GUID settings are applied are collected.

networkTime.description: Time taken in the networkTime at which a transaction is collected. Collection time is identified when the end of the transaction is recorded based on JENNIFER data server time. section during the period from the user's request to the response. Separate settings are required.

responseTime.description: Time taken to perform a transaction on the server.

sqlTime.description: Time taken to execute an SQL in the process of performing a transaction.

startTime.description: Time at which a transaction starts. This can be calculated by subtracting the response time from the end time.

txid.description: The only key for a transaction. JENNIFER distinguishes transactions by assigning a unique key for each transaction that is processed by the application.

userId.description: User ID having a business meaning. Separate settings are required.
